definitions: To examine or assess something formally with the intention of instituting change if necessary.
To write a critical assessment of a book, play, film, etc., for publication.
To look back upon (a period of time, events, etc.); to survey or re-examine.
examples: The committee will review the new policy next month.
She was asked to review the latest novel.
Let's review the events of the past year.
The general will review the troops tomorrow.
